Evaluate Strength Metrics at a Given Cut-off

Source: R/cutoff_rr_analysis.R
evaluate_cutoff_strength.Rd

Calculates strength-based metrics for a mobility network after applying a specific cut-off threshold to the relative risk matrix.

Usage

evaluate_cutoff_strength(
  mx,
  cut.off = 1,
  small.cell.reduction = 0,
  symmetric = TRUE
)

Arguments

mx

Mobility matrix with marginals

cut.off

Numeric threshold for RR values

small.cell.reduction

Small cell adjustment parameter

symmetric

Whether to symmetrize the RR matrix

Value

List of strength metrics including mean, max, CV, and Gini coefficient

Examples

# Generate synthetic mobility data
data <- generate_mobility_data(n_classes = 4, seed = 123)

# Evaluate strength metrics at different cut-offs
metrics_1.0 <- evaluate_cutoff_strength(data, cut.off = 1.0)
metrics_1.5 <- evaluate_cutoff_strength(data, cut.off = 1.5)

# Compare edge counts and strength metrics
cat("Cut-off 1.0: ", metrics_1.0$n_edges, " edges\n")
#> Cut-off 1.0:  4  edges
cat("Cut-off 1.5: ", metrics_1.5$n_edges, " edges\n")
#> Cut-off 1.5:  1  edges
